resources.string: This activity displays a scrolling list of all of the songs the user owns. It also contains an EditText where the user can search for a song. The user can select a song to play it, create a playlist, or add a song to a playlist. The user can also navigate to all other activities from this activity.

This activity displays the name of the currently playing song as well as album artwork and a bar with a sliding indicator denoting the length of the song and which part of the song is currently playing. In addition, there are back and forward buttons to move to the previous and next song in the library respectively, a pause/play button, and a volume slider.
This activity contains all the playlists the user has created. The user can select a playlist to play it and also delete playlists.

Google In-App Billing API: 
1) Send isBillingSupported request to Google Play. 
2) Send getPurchases request to see what the user already owns. 
3) Send a getSkuDetails request to show what is available for purchase. 
4) Send a getBuyIntent request. 
5) Google Play returns a PendingIntent. 
6) Launch impending intent with startIntentSenderForResult. 
7) onActivityResult indicates if purchase was successful.
